verses.text: And all the congregation lifted up their voice and cried aloud, and the people wept that night.
verses.comment: Maintained direct wording; 'cried aloud' clarifies 'lifted up their voice'.

verses.text: And all the Israelites complained against Moses and against Aaron, and the whole congregation said to them, 'If only we had died in the land of Egypt! Or if only we had died in this wilderness!'
Why has the LORD brought us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our children will be taken as plunder. Wouldn't it be better for us to return to Egypt?
verses.comment: Clarifies 'be a prey' as 'be taken as plunder'.

verses.text: And they said to each other, 'Let us appoint a leader and return to Egypt.'
verses.comment: Literal translation; 'captain' rendered as 'leader' for clarity.

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell facedown before the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel.
verses.comment: Modernized 'fell on their faces' to 'fell facedown'.

verses.text: And Joshua son of Nun, and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who spied out the land, tore their clothes.
verses.comment: No substantial changes; 'son of Jephunneh' kept for accuracy.

verses.text: And they spoke to all the congregation of the Israelites, saying, 'The land we passed through and explored is an exceedingly good land.'
verses.comment: 'Exceedingly good land' directly reflects the Hebrew emphasis.

verses.text: If the LORD delights in us, then He will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.comment: Phrase 'delights in us' is literal; 'flowing with milk and honey' is traditional and retained.

verses.text: Only do not rebel against the LORD, and do not fear the people of the land; for they are food for us. Their protection has left them, but the LORD is with us. Do not fear them.
verses.comment: 'Food for us' reflects the idiom 'bread for us.'

verses.text: But all the congregation said to stone them with stones. Then the glory of the LORD appeared at the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.
And the LORD said to Moses, 'How long will this people despise Me? How long will they not believe in Me, despite all the signs which I have done among them?'
'I will strike them with the plague and disinherit them, and I will make you a greater and mightier nation than they.'
But Moses said to the LORD, 'Then the Egyptians will hear it, for You brought up this people by Your power from among them.'

'And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that You, LORD, are in the midst of this people, for You, LORD, are seen face to face and Your cloud stands over them, and You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.'
verses.comment: Retained 'face to face', direct from Hebrew.

verses.text: 'If You kill this people as one man, then the nations who have heard of Your fame will say,'
verses.comment: 'As one man' is direct and matches idiom.

verses.text: 'Because the LORD was not able to bring this people into the land which He promised them, He slaughtered them in the wilderness.'
'Now, please, let the power of my Lord be great, just as You have spoken, saying,'
verses.comment: 'Let the power . . . be great' literal rendering.

verses.text: 'The LORD is slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, forgiving iniquity and transgression, but He by no means clears the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and fourth generation.'
'Please pardon the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of Your steadfast love, just as You have forgiven this people from Egypt until now.'
verses.comment: Phrase 'from Egypt until now' clarifies time.

verses.text: Then the LORD said, 'I have pardoned according to your word.'
'But truly, as I live, and as all the earth will be filled with the glory of the LORD,'
verses.comment: Phrase 'as I live' retained as oath.

verses.text: 'None of the men who have seen My glory and My signs that I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tested Me these ten times and have not obeyed My voice,'
'shall not see the land that I promised with an oath to their fathers, nor shall any who despised Me see it.'
verses.comment: 'Promised with an oath' for 'swore', clarifies intent.

verses.text: 'But My servant Caleb, because he had a different spirit and followed Me fully, I will bring him into the land into which he went, and his descendants shall possess it.'
'Now, the Amalekites and the Canaanites are dwelling in the valleys. Tomorrow, turn and set out into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.'
And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
'How long shall I bear with this evil congregation who complain against Me? I have heard the complaints that the Israelites make against Me.'
'Say to them, "As I live," says the LORD, "I will do to you just as you have spoken in My hearing.'"
'Your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness. All your numbered men, from twenty years old and up, who have complained against Me,'
'surely you shall not come into the land which I swore I would give you, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.'
'But your little ones, whom you said would be taken as plunder, I will bring in, and they shall know the land that you have rejected.'
'But your dead bodies will fall in this wilderness.'
'And your sons will be shepherds in the wilderness for forty years, and will bear the consequences of your unfaithfulness, until your dead bodies are finished in the wilderness.'
verses.comment: 'Will bear the consequences' for 'will bear your whoredoms.'

verses.text: 'According to the number of the days that you explored the land, forty days, for every day a year, you shall bear your iniquity forty years, and you shall know My opposition.'
verses.comment: 'Know My opposition' for 'know My breach of promise.'

verses.text: 'I, the LORD, have spoken. Surely I will do this to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against Me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.'
Now the men whom Moses sent to explore the land, who had returned and made all the congregation complain against him by spreading a bad report about the land,
verses.comment: 'Spread a bad report' for 'brought up an evil report'.

verses.text: those men who brought the bad report about the land died by the plague before the LORD.
But Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who explored the land, remained alive.
When Moses told these words to all the Israelites, the people mourned greatly.
And they rose early in the morning and went up to the high point of the hill country, saying, 'Here we are! We will go up to the place which the LORD has promised, for we have sinned.'
But Moses said, 'Why do you now transgress the command of the LORD? That will not succeed.'
'Do not go up, lest you be defeated by your enemies, for the LORD is not among you.'
'For there the Amalekites and the Canaanites shall face you, and you will fall by the sword. Because you have turned away from the LORD, the LORD will not be with you.'
But they presumed to go up to the high point of the hill country, though neither the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD nor Moses departed from the camp.
verses.comment: Clarifies that Moses and the Ark remained.

verses.text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down and attacked them and defeated them all the way to Hormah.
verses.comment: Standard translation, Hormah proper name as in original.
